interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Panasonic EW-DL82 Sonic Vibration Rechargeable Electric Toothbrush, White
Review Date: 2014/07/03
Store: Panasonic
Product Description: ['Sonic vibration rechargeable toothbrush. Clinically proven to reduce stains.']
Average Rating: 3.4
Product Details: {'Brand': 'Panasonic', 'Age Range (Description)': 'Adult', 'Special Feature': 'Brushing Timer', 'Power Source': 'Corded Electric, Battery Powered', 'Item Firmness Description': 'Soft', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Product Dimensions': '1.2 x 1 x 8.3 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'EW-DL82-W', 'Batteries': '1 Lithium Ion batteries required.', 'UPC': '885170124196', 'Manufacturer': 'Panasonic - Beauty'}
Review Text: I don't see the fuss with this toothbrush. As was mentioned in other reviews, it is smaller and more lightweight than other rechargeable toothbrushes. But, beyond that, I just don't get i. I stopped using my older Phillips Sonicare to use this for the past two+ weeks. The vibrations on this brush are very small and I find myself pushing the toothbrush into my teeth and scrubbing to be sure they are getting clean. Maybe there is some secret sonic vibration thing going on, but it didn't happen for me. If I didn't actually have to still 'brush my teeth' manually with this electric toothbrush, maybe it would be fine. However, it's not the case. Without manual intervention, my teeth did not feel clean. As an fyi, I stopped using it this morning and went back to my Phillips.
Review Title: I just don't get it
Rating: 3.0
--------------------------------------------------

profile:
**User Summary:**

This user appears to prioritize function and effectiveness in personal care products, particularly oral hygiene tools. They have demonstrated a tendency for skepticism towards claims made by product marketing, as indicated by their disappointing experience with a specific electric toothbrush that did not meet their expectations for cleanliness. They value substantial performance over superficial features, as evidenced by their preference for a former brand that they found more effective. 

Key trends observed include:
- **Performance-Oriented**: Seeks products that provide tangible results, indicating a preference for effectiveness over novelty.
- **Skeptical Consumer**: Shows reluctance to fully trust marketing claims and relies on personal experience to form opinions.
- **Brand Loyalty**: Indicates a willingness to revert to previously favored brands when new products do not meet their satisfaction levels. 

Overall, this user seems to place a strong emphasis on practical cleaning capabilities, expressing frustration when products fall short in delivering promised benefits. Their feedback suggests a need for clear and measurable utility in future purchases.
